site-address: Land West of Rushenden Road, Queenborough
notes: The site forms part of the Queenborough & Rushenden Masterplan and its inclusion for a Permission in Principle could undermine this process. The overall site is identified as having capacity for up to 480 dwellings, however application 16/507298/FULL was approved for 101 dwellings on the southern portion of the site and is under construction.. The site is vacant and is surrounded by Rushenden Road to the east and Queenborough Creek to the west.

The overall site is identified as having capacity for up to 650 dwellings, however a large part of the site was granted planning permission for 383 dwellings in May 2018 which are now under construction. The remainder of the site forms part of a detailed Local Plan allocation and its inclusion for a Permission in Principle could undermine this process.. The site comprises a cleared former industrial estate. It is surrounded by Milton Creek, Eurolink Way, Eurolink industrial estate and Sittingbourne retail park.
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

notes: The site has an application currently pending decision.. Proposed mixed use development comprising 165 no. residential apartments, medical centre and pharmacy across three blocks with associated parking and landscaping, refurbishment of existing Bell House with retention of offices and an additional storey.. The site comprises the former Bell Shopping Centre which was demolished a number of years ago. The land has been vacant since and fronts Bell Road close to Sittingbourne town centre.
